Combine multiple columns into one

Source: R/tidyverse.R
combine.Rd

Combine multiple columns into one

Usage

combine(data, name = combined, columns, sep = "-")

Arguments

data

<data.frame> or <tibble>

name

new column name, unquoted, default is combined

columns

<chr> vector of columns to combine

sep

separator between combined row data, default is "-"

Value

A <tibble> with combined columns

Examples

x <- mock_forager()

x[1, 1] <- ""

combine(x, payer, c("payer", "id"))
#> # A tibble: 10 × 8
#>    payer        class balance date_of_service date_of_release date_of_submission

#>  2 Anthem-00002 Seco… 102.    2024-05-24      2024-05-31      2024-06-02        
#>  3 Anthem-00003 Prim… 150.    2024-11-24      2024-11-27      2024-12-05        
#>  4 Cigna-00004  Seco…   0.513 2024-05-24      2024-06-01      2024-06-01        
#>  5 MAO-00005    Seco… 100.    2024-04-24      2024-05-08      2024-05-11        
#>  6 Medicaid-00… Seco… 171.    2024-10-24      2024-10-31      2024-11-01        
#>  7 Centene-000… Prim… 130.    2024-04-24      2024-05-01      2024-05-07        
#>  8 Medicare-00… Seco… 114.    2024-02-24      2024-03-04      2024-03-07
